prompt.prompt_text: No music. Medium close-up of @Jack in the helicopter backseat, rotor noise hammering. He removes his aviator sunglasses, revealing a sudden shift in his expression from energy to deep gravity. He points down through the window, his jaw tight. @Jack raises his voice over the deafening rotors: "Two years ago, a war veteran named James Lindqvist died." Cut to a tighter close-up — @Jack's hand drops slowly into his lap. His eyes are fixed forward, the weight of the words visible in the subtle tension around his eyes. He slows his pace, projecting each word deliberately against the rotor thunder. @Jack speaks loud: "But before he left... he made his son Erik one final promise..." prompt.prompt_text:

He looks out the window, then turns to camera, his expression shifting from intensity to quiet reflection. @Jack raises his voice over the noise: "Fifteen years ago, James came here seeking peace..." Cut to flashback: @Image2 A younger, rugged @James walks through a virgin boreal forest bathed in the warm, golden light of late autumn. Cut to @James stopping in a sun-dappled clearing, looking around with an expression of profound hope and determination. He runs a hand over the rough bark of a massive spruce tree, a slow smile spreading across his face as he surveys the location for his future home.
The helicopter shot is cold and desaturated with harsh window light; the flashback is warm amber tones, golden hour backlighting, and visible film grain for a nostalgic documentary feel. 4K.
